item.title: Jennifer Neundorfer on how AI is reshaping the way startups are built — live at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: AI marks the most significant revolution in startup development since the advent of cloud computing. This isn’t just an incremental change; AI is fundamentally reshaping every facet of company building, from the initial spark of idea validation and the intricate process of product development to the critical areas of team structuring and go-to-market strategies. Jennifer […]

item.title: Kristen Craft brings fresh fundraising strategy to the Foundation Stage at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Raising in 2025 doesn’t look anything like it did in 2021 — and that’s exactly the point. At TechCrunch All Stage on July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station, Kristen Craft, Head of Business Development at Fidelity Private Shares, will lead a roundtable session titled “It’s Not 2021 Anymore. Navigating the 2025 VC Landscape,” happening […]

item.title: Tinder to require new users in California to use facial recognition tech to verify their profiles
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Tinder is requiring new users in California to use facial recognition technology to verify their profiles.

item.title: Google inks its first fusion power deal with Commonwealth Fusion Systems
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Google will invest in Commonwealth Fusion Systems and buy 200 MW of electricity from its forthcoming power plant.

item.title: Spotify revamps its Discover Weekly playlist after 10 years
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Spotify is making Discover Weekly more customizable by genre.

item.title: Why AI will eat McKinsey’s lunch — but not today
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Navin Chaddha, managing director of the 55-year-old Silicon Valley venture firm Mayfield, is betting big on AI's ability to transform people-heavy industries like consulting, law, and accounting.

item.title: OpenAI reportedly ‘recalibrating’ compensation in response to Meta hires
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: With Meta successfully poaching a number of its senior researchers, an OpenAI executive reportedly reassured team members Saturday that company leadership has not “been standing idly by.”

item.title: Trump says he’s found a buyer for TikTok
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A group of “very wealthy people” is set to buy short-form video app TikTok, according to President Donald Trump.

item.title: With ‘F1’, Apple finally has a theatrical hit
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Looks like Apple has its first bona fide box office hit.

item.title: Authors call on publishers to limit their use of AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: An open letter from authors including Lauren Groff, Lev Grossman, R.F. Kuang, Dennis Lehane, and Geoffrey Maguire calls on book publishers to pledge to limit their use of AI tools, for example by committing to only hire human audiobook narrators.

item.title: Meta reportedly hires four more researchers from OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Looks like Meta isn’t done poaching talent from OpenAI.

item.title: Week in Review: Meta’s AI recruiting blitz
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review! Lots of news for you this week, including Travis Kalanick's possible return, CoreWeave's CEO is now worth $10 billion, Apple users aren't happy with how the company is promoting its new F1 movie, and much more.

item.title: Vitalik Buterin has reservations about Sam Altman’s World project
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin is arguing that the digital identification approach being promoted by Sam Altman’s World project has real privacy risks.

item.title: Anthropic’s Claude AI became a terrible business owner in experiment that got ‘weird’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Researchers at Anthropic and AI safety company Andon Labs gave an instance of Claude Sonnet 3.7 an office vending machine to run. And hilarity ensued.

item.title: FBI, cybersecurity firms say a prolific hacking crew is now targeting airlines and the transportation sector
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The fresh wave of attacks targeting airlines comes soon after the hackers hit the U.K. retail sector and the insurance industry.

item.title: Rob Biederman will help founders rethink how to scale at TechCrunch All Stage 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: If you’re a founder looking to grow your startup, chances are you’re wrestling with more than just product or capital. Talent, scale, and smart execution are the real battlegrounds. That’s exactly what TechCrunch All Stage 2025 is built to address on July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station. Rob Biederman, managing partner at Asymmetric Capital […]

item.title: Congress might block state AI laws for a decade. Here’s what it means.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan, Maxwell Zeff
item.description: A federal proposal that would ban states and local governments from regulating AI for 10 years could soon be signed into law, as Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX) and other lawmakers work to secure its inclusion into a GOP megabill ahead of a key July 4 deadline. Here's what's at stake.

item.title: As job losses loom, Anthropic launches program to track AI’s economic fallout
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: As warnings mount about AI’s potential to displace millions of jobs, Anthropic on Friday launched a its Economic Futures Program, new initiative to support research and policy development that addresses AI’s economic impacts.

item.title: YouTube’s mobile video editor is coming to iOS
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The app is Google's attempt to compete with ByteDance's popular CapCut editor.

item.title: Jesse Draper’s Halogen Ventures closes $30M Fund III to focus on ‘future of family’
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The firm was founded in 2015 by Jesse Draper. The fund will focus on the physical and financial health of households.
